sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The ln function is used to find the natural logarithm (base e) of a number. For example, ln ( 1) is 0.
sections.text_content: The ln function is used to find the natural logarithm (base e) of a number. For example, ln ( 1) is 0.
sections.mdown_content: The **ln** function is used to find the natural logarithm (base e) of a number. For example, **ln** ( 1) is 0.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 1 .. 100
            put "Logarithm of ", i, " is ", ln ( i )
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the logarithms of 1, 2, 3, … up to 100.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the logarithms of 1, 2, 3,  up to 100.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the logarithms of 1, 2, 3,  up to 100.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: See also the exp (exponential) function. You cannot take the logarithm of zero or a negative number.
sections.text_content: See also the exp (exponential) function. You cannot take the logarithm of zero or a negative number.
sections.mdown_content: See also the **exp** (exponential) function. You cannot take the logarithm of zero or a negative number.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
exp (the exponentiation function).

See also predefined unit Math.
